intro: Dichapetalum thollonii, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open woodland or grassland habitats. Its unique floral structure and ornamental value make it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
